alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 10:54PM CST until January 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ TUESDAY TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches. Locally higher amounts are possible. Northerly winds gusting as high as 30 to 35 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma County. In Nebraska, Dundy, Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. * WHEN...From 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Tuesday to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be extremely difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute. Road closures may be possible, avoid driving around barricades. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The northerly winds gusting up to 30 to 35 MPH could cause blowing and drifting snow, even after snowfall has ended.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
